text:
I’m trying use the debugger in vscode, but it doesn’t seem to correctly detect my environment. The code runs fine in the Julia REPL, but in the vscode Julia Debugger it doesn’t find basic functionalities from included libraries, e.g.:
```Exception has occurred: UndefVarError
UndefVarError: FastDense not defined```
What’s bizarre is that the bottom bar in vscode shows that the debugger is using the right environment (same as my REPL). What am I doing wrong? Is there any way to run the debugger with the nice interface directly on the Julia REPL?

elements.text: I’m trying use the debugger in vscode, but it doesn’t seem to correctly detect my environment. The code runs fine in the Julia REPL, but in the vscode Julia Debugger it doesn’t find basic functionalities from included libraries, e.g.:

Exception has occurred: UndefVarError
UndefVarError: FastDense not defined

What’s bizarre is that the bottom bar in vscode shows that the debugger is using the right environment (same as my REPL). What am I doing wrong? Is there any way to run the debugger with the nice interface directly on the Julia REPL?

text: Try to ask in <#C6LV2R5JB|vscode>. Ideally it should work
Are you actually sure that VSCode is in the same env? Sometimes I find that it reports the wrong env in the lower right corner

elements.text: Are you actually sure that VSCode is in the same env? Sometimes I find that it reports the wrong env in the lower right corner

text: Is there any way to double check that?

elements.text: Is there any way to double check that?

text: Yeah, type `]` i nthe REPL, it shows your actual project

elements.text: i nthe REPL, it shows your actual project

text: I.e. mine says `(InfluenzaCore) pkg>` , whereas the bottom-right says `(Influenza)`
I managed to solve it by using the `@run` and `@enter` commands in the REPL. I keep the VSCode debugging GUI within the REPL. Thanks for the help!

commands in the REPL. I keep the VSCode debugging GUI within the REPL. Thanks for the help!
